required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Mogamulizumab + Nivolumab in Subjects w/Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label, Multicenter, Phase 1/2 Study of Mogamulizumab in Combination With Nivolumab in Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to characterize the safety and tolerability and determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or the recommended fixed dose of the combinations of mogamulizumab and nivolumab in subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multicenter, Phase 1/2 open-label, dose-finding and cohort expansion study of the anti-CCR4 antibody mogamulizumab in combination therapy with the anti-PD-1 antibody nivolumab in adult subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors.
Phase 1 will identify the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or the highest protocol-defined dose in absence of exceeding the MTD, of the combination regimen of mogamulizumab and nivolumab subjects. Phase 1 will enroll up to 12 subjects. Phase 2 will explore the safety, efficacy and anti-tumor activity of the highest tolerated dose of the combination regimen. Phase 2 will enroll up to 184 subjects.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study medications until 14 days after the last dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: combination regimen of mogamulizumab and nivolumab in subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects experiencing dose-limiting toxicity
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study medications until 14 days after the last dose of study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective tumor response rate according to RECIST
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to every 12 weeks, until data cut off

arm_group.description: During parts 1 and 2, mogamulizumab and nivolumab are administered at appropriate intervals. Part 1 (Dose Escalation Part): During cohort 1 to 2, mogamulizumab and nivolumab are administered in combination. Part 2 (Expansion Part): Patients will be treated with maximum tolerated dose established in the dose escalation part for each combination.
